content: AMA SG Young Investment Insurance General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Sep 2018I have a loose shoulder joint that is causing me some discomfort and pain. Can i claim my insurance for this to see a specialist?I had a bad fall about a year ago, and after that have been hearing a snaping sound on my left shoulder blade. It’s really in discomfort and i saw a regular GP once who said that it was just a strain. But it won’t go away. How do i go to a specialist for this? And which insurance can I claim? I have a personal accident plan by FWD and the private H&S by NTUC income. My agent has left the industry sadly.1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Soh Sing Heng, Financial Blogger at SG Young InvestmentLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 11 Sep 2018You might be able to claim for personal accident. For private H&S, its only for hospitalisation unless you had stayed inpatient for the loose shoulder problem before and still can claim for outpatient treatment (within 3 months after discharge for NTUC). You'll have to check with a financial advisor on the details of your plan. For your FWD, you can definitely contact them directly and they will be able to advise you. 0 comments1
